resources.string: Bánffy Castle is an architectural monument situated in Bonţida, a village in the vicinity of Cluj-Napoca, Romania, with construction phases and stylistic features belonging to Renaissance, Baroque, Neoclassical and Neogothic styles."

The Transylvanian Museum of Ethnography is situated in Cluj-Napoca, Romania. With a history of more than 80 years, the Ethnographic Museum of Transylvania is one of the first and greatest of its kind in Romania
The Dormition of the Theotokos Cathedral is the most famous Romanian Orthodox church of Cluj-Napoca, Romania.
The Matthias Corvinus Monument is a monument in Cluj-Napoca, Romania. This classified historic monument, conceived by János Fadrusz and opened in 1902
ELECTRIC CASTLE is a Romanian music festival that takes place every year on the Transylvanian spectacular domain of Banffy Castle, near Cluj-Napoca.
Untold Festival is the largest annual electronic music festival held in Romania, taking place in Cluj-Napoca. Untold has been designated Best Major Festival within European Festival Awards 2015
